author: rab1234
title: Good build for my 5 year old with some playability too
review:
Overall Rating

4/5. My 5 year old thoroughly enjoyed this build and he definitely had a sense of accomplishment that he was able to put the whole thing together himself.  He chose to build just the main build first, so this review is based only on that one.

Building Experience

This was completed in about 15 minutes at a time over a couple of weeks which seemed to be perfect for my 5 year old.  There may have been 1 or 2 times I helped, but I think he did almost everything without any guidance, so the build itself was not too complicated.  There are however a few interesting techniques and enough variation to keep the build fresh.  There is one bit that I found a little weird.  Many of the windows, basketball hoop, etc. are only attached at the bottom so they come out easily.  Honestly, it's unclear to me why they did that. It doesn't make the build any easier and they seem to get knocked out during play as well.  -1 point for this!

Parts

Lots of white bricks which are useful, windows and door in a good dark tan color, and stairs are always useful.  Plus lots of red roof pieces (which you can never have too many of), but not very many unique parts except the light brick.

Playability

Good playability for the kid who has 100 cars, but only 1 or 2 buildings.  My son liked the garage door and squeezing the car in there.  Plus the 3 figs, doghouse, brick built dog, basketball hoop, furnished interior, and light brick contribute towards a high playability score. 

Value for the Money

Getting this one new on sale for $50 or gently used for around that price would probably be worth it.  I wouldn't pay $70 for it though.  Pretty good set overall!
